metadata.title: Hydra Market - Graph Database Dataset
metadata.description: Complete entity-relationship model of the Hydra Market darknet marketplace case for graph database import. Enriched with source citations, STIX 2.1 type mappings, and applicable forensic/legal standards.

STIX_2.1.name: Structured Threat Information Expression 2.1
STIX_2.1.usage: SDO/SRO type mappings on each node and relationship

XPolizei_2.0.name: XPolizei 2.0 Datenaustauschstandard
XPolizei_2.0.usage: German police data exchange types on relevant nodes

ISO_27037.name: ISO/IEC 27037:2012 — Digital Evidence Identification, Collection, Acquisition, Preservation
ISO_27037.usage: Applicable to evidence seizure events and digital assets

ISO_27042.name: ISO/IEC 27042:2015 — Digital Evidence Analysis and Interpretation
ISO_27042.usage: Applicable to blockchain analysis and financial tracing

NIST_800-86.name: NIST SP 800-86 — Guide to Integrating Forensic Techniques into Incident Response
NIST_800-86.usage: Applicable to forensic data handling of crypto assets and server infrastructure

EO_13694.name: Executive Order 13694 — Blocking Property of Certain Persons Engaging in Significant Malicious Cyber-Enabled Activities
EO_13694.usage: Legal basis for OFAC sanctions designations

OFAC.title: Treasury Press Release jy0701: Treasury Sanctions Russia-Based Hydra and Garantex

CHA_SANCTIONS.title: Chainalysis: OFAC Sanctions Hydra Marketplace and Garantex — Background and Analysis

CHA_POST_HYDRA.title: Chainalysis: Post-Hydra Dark Web Market Analysis 2022

ELLIPTIC.title: Elliptic: $5 Billion Hydra Cryptocurrency Marketplace Analysis

TRM.title: TRM Labs: Hydra — The Largest Darknet Marketplace Shutdown by Law Enforcement

DOJ.title: U.S. DOJ: Justice Department Investigation Leads to Shutdown of Largest Online Darknet Marketplace

BKA.title: BKA Pressemitteilung: Hydra Market — Weltweit größter illegaler Darknet-Marktplatz abgeschaltet

GOONETILLEKE_2023.title: Goonetilleke et al.: Hydra — Lessons from the World's Largest Darknet Market

VOROBYOV_2020.title: Vorobyov (Vice): Inside Hydra Dead-Drop Drug Delivery System

RUSSIAN_COURT_2024.title: Moscow Regional Court: Moiseyev Sentencing (Life Imprisonment)

nodes.label: Promservice Ltd.
nodes.aliases: Hosting Company Full Drive; All Wheel Drive; 4x4host.ru

nodes.label: JCODE Team
nodes.role: Joint Criminal Opioid and Darknet Enforcement

nodes.label: SUEX OTC
nodes.note: First VASP sanctioned in entirety by OFAC

nodes.label: CHATEX
nodes.note: Second VASP sanctioned in entirety by OFAC

nodes.label: RAMP (Russian Anonymous Marketplace)
nodes.note: After RAMP closure, Hydra became monopolist in Russian DNM space

nodes.label: OMG!OMG! Market
nodes.note: Showed vendor/admin overlap with Hydra via shared deposit addresses; hit by DDoS June 2022

nodes.label: Mega Darknet Market
nodes.note: Gained share after OMG DDoS attack (June 2022)

nodes.label: Blacksprut Market
nodes.note: Hacked November 2022; peaked at 68.5% market share before hack

nodes.label: Ryuk
nodes.note: Part of $8M ransomware proceeds laundered through Hydra

nodes.label: Sodinokibi/REvil
nodes.note: Part of $8M ransomware proceeds laundered through Hydra

nodes.label: Bitfinex
nodes.note: Hydra used to launder 2016 Bitfinex hack funds

nodes.label: AlphaBay
nodes.note: Comparison: AlphaBay had ~$1B in total value when seized vs. Hydra $5.2B

nodes.label: Federation Tower (Moscow)
nodes.note: Physical location of Garantex, SUEX, and CHATEX operations

nodes.label: Stanislav Moiseyev
nodes.convicted_of: Organizing criminal syndicate; drug production and distribution
nodes.historic_note: First life sentence for drug trafficking in Russia

nodes.label: Dmitry Olegovich Pavlov
nodes.charges: Conspiracy to distribute narcotics; Conspiracy to commit money laundering

nodes.label: Drug Sales
nodes.details: Cocaine, methamphetamine, LSD, heroin, opioids, precursors; wholesale and retail

nodes.label: Dead-Drop Delivery (Klad/Zakladka)
nodes.cost_share: >50% of drug price for some items
nodes.note: Uber-like dead-drop courier system across CIS countries

nodes.label: Bitcoin Bank Mixer
nodes.purpose: Obfuscate crypto transactions for money laundering
nodes.note: Tightly controlled BTC mixing infrastructure; used to launder Bitfinex hack funds

nodes.label: Cash-Out Services
nodes.details: BTC to RUB; cash deliveries; wire transfers; SIM card payments; physical buried cash

nodes.label: Ransomware-as-a-Service
nodes.note: Facilitated laundering of $8M+ in ransomware proceeds (Ryuk, Sodinokibi/REvil, Conti variants)

nodes.label: RAMP Shut Down
nodes.description: Russian authorities close RAMP; Hydra becomes dominant

nodes.label: BKA/ZIT Investigation Begins
nodes.description: German authorities begin investigating Hydra infrastructure

nodes.label: OMG!OMG! DDoS Attack
nodes.description: OMG!OMG! market hit by DDoS attack; caused migration of vendors to Mega and Blacksprut

nodes.label: Blacksprut Market Hacked
nodes.description: Blacksprut marketplace hacked after reaching 68.5% market share

nodes.label: Garantex Estonian License Revoked
nodes.description: Estonia's FIU revoked Garantex's virtual currency license for AML violations; Garantex continued operating from Moscow

nodes.label: Moiseyev Sentenced to Life
nodes.historic_note: First life sentence for drug trafficking in Russia

nodes.label: Estonia
nodes.note: Garantex was registered here but lost license Feb 2022

nodes.label: Executive Order 13694
nodes.title: Blocking Property of Certain Persons Engaging in Significant Malicious Cyber-Enabled Activities
nodes.note: Legal authority under which OFAC designated Hydra, Garantex, SUEX, CHATEX, Bitpapa, NetExchange

nodes.label: 2022 DNM Market Overview
nodes.note: Total 2022 DNM revenue fell from $3.1B (2021) to $1.5B — largely due to Hydra shutdown

relationships.outcome: Hydra became dominant after RAMP closure

relationships.note: Shared vendor/admin deposit addresses indicate overlap
